entry.title: Fears of new attack as Aliyev threatens to forcibly open corridor through Armenia

media:group.media:title: Fears of new attack as Aliyev threatens to forcibly open corridor through Armenia
media:group.media:description:
Worries of a new escalation of conflict and a large-scale military attack by Azerbaijan have been raised after Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev said Armenia will not be able to stop the opening of the so-called ‚ÄúZangezur corridor‚Äù through its territory. Those comments have led some observers to speculate that Aliyev may order new military aggression in order to forcibly open an overland corridor through southern Armenia.

entry.title: Yerevan to import 87 German buses next year

media:group.media:title: Yerevan to import 87 German buses next year
media:group.media:description:
üìçA major summit of the leaders of the Collective Security Treaty Organization, a Russian-led military alliance, ended in Yerevan without an agreement on providing defense aid to Armenia after Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan refused to sign a declaration to that effect. üìçArmenia plans to import nearly 90 German-made buses next year. üìçThe Armenian government approved forming an Interior Ministry and disbanding the Ministry of Emergency Situations.

entry.title: Mehriban Aliyeva says goodbye to UNESCO

media:group.media:title: Mehriban Aliyeva says goodbye to UNESCO
media:group.media:description:
In the latest edition of Insights with Eric Hacopian, Eric talks about the recent passage of a resolution in the French Senate calling for sanctions against Azerbaijan. Eric also discusses the planned introduction of universal income declarations by the Armenian government and Azerbaijani Vice President and First Lady Mehriban Aliyeva‚Äôs resignation from UNESCO.
